SafetyInspectionBy: Has not been inspected by an external agency

_prev_prog_2.Description: Gholson water storage facility, 5 million gallon capacity, shlorine boosting to maintain required disinfection residual

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
GHOLSON WATER STORAGE FACILITY    

3310 Gholson Road, Waco, Texas 76704



This program is adopted to implement 40 CFR 68, Risk Management of Highly Hazardous Materials.  This program will help prevent the occurance of, or minimize the consequences of, catastrophic releases by stating our policies and procedures for the management of process hazards in startup, operation, inspection, maintenance, and the other matters addressed in the federal standard.



Our program encourages and requires maximum employee participation and includes all elements of the employee participation in the standard.  We shall, as a minimum: a) consult with employees and their representatives on the conduct and development of the process hazard review and other elements of the risk management plan, and b) provide our employees and their representatives access to the process hazard review and all other information required to be developed under that standard.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

The City of Waco Water Utilities Department believes that preventative maintenance and training are the keys to minimizing the potential for accidental releases.  Standard Operating procedures have been reviewed and revised to enable employees to perform their work in a safe and efficient manner.  

The department has taken steps to educate and inform the operators, supervisors, and maintenance crews in the appropriate response to an accidental release.  The training includes classroom training and operating procedures on the proper response to emergency situations.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES

The Gholson Ground Storage facility uses chlorine to boost the disinfection residual of treated water.  The chlorine cylinders are located inside a building, which will act as a passive mitigation in the event of a release.  There are chlorine sensors and entry alarms connected to the SCADA system.  The injectors operate on a vacuum, so loss of vacuum stops chlorine

use.

CHEMICAL MAXIMUM INVENTORY    Chlorine    6,000 pounds

THRESHOLD QUANTITY                    2,500 pounds



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have not been any releases, exposures, or property damage at this site in the past five years.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

The department has implemented a Risk Management Plan that meets or exceeds the requirements of 40 CFR 68.  Our philosophy is to continually improve the safe working conditions of our employees to minimize accidents and reduce the potential for either an on-site or off-site release.  With this in mind, the department is incorporating many of the Risk Management Plan elements into other areas of the processes not covered under 40 CFR 68 to improve overall safety of the site.  This includes beginning an environmental management system to reduce any adverse environmental impact.
